a_role=\"menuitemradio\":
The issue in the given code snippet is that the element with the role "menuitemradio" is missing the required "aria-checked" attribute.

Here's the corrected version of the code snippet:

```html
<a aria-selected="false" href="..." role="menuitemradio" aria-checked="false">
```

In this corrected version, the required "aria-checked" attribute is added to the element with the role "menuitemradio".
div_role=\"combobox\":
The issue in the given code snippet is that the element with the role "combobox" is missing the required ARIA attribute `aria-controls` which associates the combobox with the controlled element (e.g., a listbox).

Here's the corrected version of the code snippet:

```html
<div aria-expanded="true" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-labelledby="..." aria-controls="listbox-id" role="combobox">
```

Make sure to replace `listbox-id` with the actual ID of the listbox element that this combobox controls.
